Hi Luca,

There are more ways to generate more complexity. The first one I =
think 
of, is to add more nodes in the substrate as generations pass. The 
=
positions of the nodes can be determined by some algorithmic way.
The other=
 way is a bit unclear, but here is the idea. The same CPPN 
that builds the=
 network can be used to build the substrate via one 
additional output (tre=
ating it as an output of a spatial CPPN). 

Peter

--- In neat@yahoogroups.=
com, "Luca_PI" <wolfgroups@...> wrote:
>
> Hi Ken,
> thanks for the answer.=
 Maybe I have not understood all the background.
> What I tried to explain =
is that looking the code the substrate simply
> generates the connections f=
or a static structure network. So, in a
> simple way, I was thinking if usi=
ng it as an activation function (in
> this case it will have one input and =
one output) would have given some
> result.
> The connection in the network=
 would be fixed, giving a "hierarchy" in
> the list of input, and the subst=
rate (as activation function) would
> generate the complexity. But maybe is=
 not in this way :P
> Thanks,
> 
> Luca
